body_html: Unfortunately raising an error in the __lt__ (etc.) operators would break many shape functions, which rely on the comparison operations being tri-state (True and False when the values are both known; None when either value is unknown). It would be nice to raise an error on max() if either dimension is unknown, but I'm not sure of a way to do that without breaking the existing behavior of the comparison operators.
body_text: Unfortunately raising an error in the __lt__ (etc.) operators would break many shape functions, which rely on the comparison operations being tri-state (True and False when the values are both known; None when either value is unknown). It would be nice to raise an error on max() if either dimension is unknown, but I'm not sure of a way to do that without breaking the existing behavior of the comparison operators.
body: Unfortunately raising an error in the `__lt__` (etc.) operators would break many shape functions, which rely on the comparison operations being tri-state (`True` and `False` when the values are both known; `None` when either value is unknown). It would be nice to raise an error on `max()` if either dimension is unknown, but I'm not sure of a way to do that without breaking the existing behavior of the comparison operators.
